body_html:
@zheng-xq Could you help review the revised PR? Thanks.

To support ROCm and minimize impact to user models, GPU common runtime, and its dependent Eigen, is designed to be switchable to either CUDA or ROCm, via macros determined at configure-time (GOOGLE_CUDA or TENSORFLOW_USE_ROCM). The infrastructure to introduce TENSORFLOW_USE_ROCM is under review at #20277 . Since the PR is not approved and merged yet, ROCm-specific logic is not yet included in this pull request.

To support ROCm and minimize impact to user models, GPU common runtime, and its dependent Eigen, is designed to be switchable to either CUDA or ROCm, via macros determined at configure-time (GOOGLE_CUDA or TENSORFLOW_USE_ROCM). The infrastructure to introduce TENSORFLOW_USE_ROCM is under review at #20277 . Since the PR is not approved and merged yet, ROCm-specific logic is not yet included in this pull request.
body:
@zheng-xq Could you help review the revised PR? Thanks.

To support ROCm and minimize impact to user models, GPU common runtime, and its dependent `Eigen`, is designed to be switchable to either CUDA or ROCm, via macros determined at configure-time (`GOOGLE_CUDA` or `TENSORFLOW_USE_ROCM`). The infrastructure to introduce `TENSORFLOW_USE_ROCM` is under review at #20277 . Since the PR is not approved and merged yet, ROCm-specific logic is not yet included in this pull request.
